item.title: Meta Accused of Torrenting Porn to Advance Its Goal of AI ‘Superintelligence’
item.description: Strike 3 Holdings is suing Meta in federal court, alleging the tech giant pirated copyrighted adult videos to train its AI models.

item.title: Meta Accused of Torrenting Porn to Advance Its Goal of AI ‘Superintelligence’
item.description: Strike 3 Holdings is suing Meta in federal court, alleging the tech giant pirated copyrighted adult videos to train its AI models.

item.title: Internet Archive’s big battle with music publishers ends in settlement
item.description: The true cost of keeping the Internet Archive alive will likely remain unknown.

item.title: Judge: Anthropic’s $1.5B settlement is being shoved “down the throat of authors”
item.description: Feeling “misled,” judge refuses to rubber-stamp Anthropic’s proposed settlement.

item.title: Nintendo Switch modder ordered to pay $2 million in piracy lawsuit

item.title: Anthropic to pay $1.5 billion to authors in landmark AI settlement
item.description: In what’s potentially the first major payout to creatives whose work was used to train AI systems, Anthropic has reached an agreement to pay “at least” a staggering $1.5 billion, plus interest, to aut

item.title: Anthropic to pay $1.5 billion to authors in landmark AI settlement
item.description: In what’s potentially the first major payout to creatives whose work was used to train AI systems, Anthropic has reached an agreement to pay “at least” a staggering $1.5 billion, plus interest, to aut

item.title: Anthropic Agrees to Pay Authors at Least $1.5 Billion in AI Copyright Settlement
item.description: Anthropic will pay at least $3,000 for each copyrighted work that it pirated. The company downloaded unauthorized copies of books in early efforts to gather training data for its AI tools.

item.title: Anthropic Agrees to Pay Authors at Least $1.5 Billion in AI Copyright Settlement
item.description: Anthropic will pay at least $3,000 for each copyrighted work that it pirated. The company downloaded unauthorized copies of books in early efforts to gather training data for its AI tools.

item.title: Warner Bros. sues Midjourney to stop AI knockoffs of Batman, Scooby-Doo
item.description: Warner Bros. case builds on arguments raised in a Disney/Universal lawsuit.

item.title: Warner Bros. Discovery sues Midjourney for generating ‘countless’ copies of its characters

item.title: Authors celebrate “historic” settlement coming soon in Anthropic class action
item.description: Advocates fear such settlements will “financially ruin” the AI industry.

item.title: Anthropic settles AI book piracy lawsuit
item.description: Anthropic has settled a class action lawsuit with a group of US authors who accused the AI startup of copyright infringement. In a legal filing on Tuesday, Anthropic says it has negotiated a “proposed

item.title: Anthropic Settles High-Profile AI Copyright Lawsuit Brought by Book Authors
item.description: Anthropic faced the prospect of more than $1 trillion in damages, a sum that could have threatened the company’s survival if the case went to trial.

item.title: Anthropic Settles High-Profile AI Copyright Lawsuit Brought by Book Authors
item.description: Anthropic faced the prospect of more than $1 trillion in damages, a sum that could have threatened the company’s survival if the case went to trial.

item.title: Is It Ever Legal—or Ethical—to Remove DRM?
item.description: Digital Rights Management software makes it difficult to copy movies, music, ebooks, and games that you already own. There are ways around it, but breaking DRM opens up legal and ethical concerns.

item.title: Is It Ever Legal—or Ethical—to Remove DRM?
item.description: Digital Rights Management software makes it difficult to copy movies, music, ebooks, and games that you already own. There are ways around it, but breaking DRM opens up legal and ethical concerns.

item.title: OpenAI offers 20 million user chats in ChatGPT lawsuit. NYT wants 120 million.
item.description: OpenAI asks judge to drastically limit NYT access to ChatGPT logs.

item.title: YouTuber faces jail time for showing off Android-based gaming handhelds
